name: Asian Lettuce Wraps
ingredients: {'quantity': '16', 'unit': '', 'name': 'Boston Bibb or butter lettuce leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'lean ground beef'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'cooking oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'hoisin sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'fresh garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'rice wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'minced pickled ginger'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'Asian chile pepper sauce, or to taste (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) can', 'name': 'water chestnuts, drained and finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'green onions, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'Asian (dark) sesame oil'}
steps: Gather all ingredients.. Rinse whole lettuce leaves and pat dry, being careful not to tear them; set aside.. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Add beef; cook and stir until browned and crumbly, 5 to 7 minutes. Drain and discard grease; transfer beef to a bowl.. Add onion to the same skillet; cook and stir until just tender, 5 to 7 minutes.. Stir in hoisin sauce, garlic, soy sauce, vinegar, ginger, and chile pepper sauce until well combined. Add water chestnuts, green onions, sesame oil, and cooked beef; cook and stir until the onions just begin to wilt, about 2 minutes.. Arrange lettuce leaves around the outer edge of a large serving platter; spoon beef mixture in the center.

name: Quick Asian Lettuce Wraps
ingredients: {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'uncooked white rice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'ground pork'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'green onions, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'minced garlic'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(14 ounce) package', 'name': 'firm tofu, drained and cubed'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'carrots, shredded'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'hoisin sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'sesame oil'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'hot chile paste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'head', 'name': 'iceberg lettuce leaves, separated'}
steps: In a saucepan combine the water and rice. Bring to a boil, cover, and reduce heat to a simmer. Simmer for 20 minutes, until water is absorbed. Set aside and keep warm.. Heat oil in a wok over medium-high heat. Cook the pork, green onions, and garlic for 5 to 7 minutes, or until lightly brown. Add the tofu, carrot, Hoisin, and soy sauce, stirring frequently until heated through. Remove from heat, and stir in the sesame oil and chile paste.. To serve: spoon a small amount of rice into each lettuce leaf, top with the stir-fry mixture, and drizzle with additional soy sauce or hoisin, if desired. Wrap the lettuce leaf to enclose the filling.

name: Chef John's Chicken Lettuce Wraps
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'skinless, boneless chicken thighs, coarsely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) can', 'name': 'water chestnuts, drained and minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'diced shiitake mushroom caps'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'minced yellow onion'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped green onion'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'freshly grated ginger'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chicken stock'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'rice wine vinegar'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'ketchup'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'sesame oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'red pepper flakes'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'dry mustard'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chopped fresh cilantro, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chopped fresh basil, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chopped green onion, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '16', 'unit': 'leaves', 'name': 'iceberg lettuce, or as needed'}
steps: Combine chicken, water chestnuts, mushrooms, yellow onion, 1/3 cup green onion, 1 tablespoon soy sauce, ginger, and 2 teaspoons brown sugar together in a bowl. Pat mixture down, cover bowl with plastic wrap, and refrigerate until ready to use.. Whisk chicken stock, vinegar, garlic, ketchup, 1 tablespoon soy sauce, sesame oil, 2 teaspoons brown sugar, pepper flakes, and dry mustard together in a bowl until glaze well-mixed.. Heat vegetable oil in a heavy nonstick skillet over high heat. Add chicken mixture; cook and stir until chicken no longer looks raw, about 2 minutes. Add 1/2 the glaze mixture; cook and stir until chicken begins to caramelize and brown, 10 to 15 minutes.. Reduce heat to medium-low. Pour remaining glaze into chicken mixture; cook until heated through and slightly reduced, about 3 minutes. Stir in cilantro, basil, and 1 1/2 tablespoons green onion. Transfer chicken mixture to a bowl; serve with lettuce leaves as wrappers.

name: Chicken Lettuce Wraps
ingredients: {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'pounds', 'name': 'ground chicken'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'red bell pepper, cut into large dice'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'rice wine vinegar, or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'grated fresh ginger'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'hot pepper sauce (such as Tabasco®)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'Asian (toasted) sesame oil'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chunky peanut butter'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'hot water'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'dashes', 'name': 'hot pepper sauce (such as Tabasco®)'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': '', 'name': 'large leaves of iceberg lettuce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'carrots, shredded'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'chopped green onion, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'chopped fresh cilantro'}
steps: Cook and stir ground chicken in a large skillet until the meat is crumbly and no longer pink, about 10 minutes. Drain excess grease. Stir red bell pepper into chicken; cook and stir until pepper is slightly softened, about 5 more minutes.. Whisk 1/2 cup soy sauce, rice wine vinegar, ginger, 5 dashes hot pepper sauce, and sesame oil in a bowl; pour over chicken mixture. Cook and stir chicken mixture with sauce over low heat until flavors have blended, 5 to 10 minutes.. Mash peanut butter with hot water in a small bowl until smooth; stir 3 tablespoons soy sauce and 5 dashes hot pepper sauce into the mixture. Set dipping sauce aside.. Form lettuce leaves into cup shapes and fill with chicken mixture. Top lettuce wraps with shredded carrots, sprinkle with green onion and cilantro, and a spoonful of peanut dipping sauce.

name: Tuna Lettuce Wraps
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(6 ounce) can', 'name': 'chunk light tuna, drained'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chopped onion'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'light mayonnaise'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'leaves', 'name': 'green lettuce, rinsed and patted dry'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'finely shredded low-fat Cheddar cheese (Optional)'}
steps: Combine tuna, mayonnaise, onion, salt, and pepper in a bowl.. Lay lettuce leaves out. Divide tuna mixture among the leaves, placing it in the middle of each leaf. Sprinkle Cheddar cheese over the tuna. Roll leaves up to create wraps.

name: Lettuce Leaf Tacos
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green bell pepper, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'yellow onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chicken stock (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'ground beef'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'taco seasoning'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'roma (plum) tomatoes, chopped'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) package', 'name': 'shredded Cheddar cheese'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': '', 'name': 'large romaine lettuce leaves'}
steps: Cook and stir green bell pepper and yellow onion in a skillet over medium heat with olive oil and chicken broth until onion is translucent, about 5 minutes.. Place ground beef in a separate skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir with taco seasoning until beef is browned and crumbly, 5 to 8 minutes. Drain excess grease.. Sprinkle tomatoes with salt in a bowl. Place Cheddar cheese into a separate bowl.. Fill each lettuce leaf with about 2 tablespoons beef filling; top with 1 to 2 teaspoons green pepper mixture, tomato, and about 1 1/2 tablespoons Cheddar cheese.

name: Easy "Peking Duck" Lettuce Cups
ingredients: {'quantity': '6', 'unit': '', 'name': 'whole duck legs'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'kosher salt'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'five-spice powder'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'freshly ground black pepper'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green onions, cut into large pieces'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, halved'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'chopped green onion'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'hoisin sauce'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'lemon, juiced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'sesame oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'hot sauce'}, {'quantity': '18', 'unit': '', 'name': 'whole butter or Bibb lettuce leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cucumber, diced'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green onions, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'sesame seeds'}
steps: Preheat the oven to 250 degrees F (120 degrees C).. Prepare duck: Place duck legs into a large bowl and drizzle with oil. Sprinkle with salt, five-spice powder, and black pepper; mix to evenly coat.. Sprinkle large green onion pieces into a baking dish large enough to hold duck legs in a single layer. Place duck legs, skin-side up, on top of green onions. Scatter garlic over duck. Place a piece of parchment paper directly on top of duck to help retain moisture. Cover the baking dish tightly with aluminum foil.. Bake in the preheated oven for 3 hours. Turn off the oven, crack open the oven door, and let duck rest in the oven for 1 hour; do not uncover the dish during this time.. Remove the dish from the oven and let cool to room temperature. Baste duck with rendered fat in the dish. Place the parchment paper back over duck and re-wrap the dish in aluminum foil. Refrigerate for 8 hours to overnight.. Make sauce: Mix together hoisin sauce, lemon juice, sesame oil, and hot sauce in a small bowl. Set aside.. Remove duck meat from bones; leave skin on. Cut meat into 1/2-inch cubes.. Remove 1 tablespoon rendered fat from the dish to a skillet over medium-high heat. Cook and stir 1/2 of the cubed meat in hot fat until pieces are brown and crispy, 4 to 5 minutes. Add remaining meat; cook and stir until duck is just heated through, about 1 minute more. Stir in 1 tablespoon chopped green onion.. Spoon duck mixture into lettuce leaves. Drizzle with sauce; garnish with cucumber, green onions, and sesame seeds.

name: Easy Lettuce Wraps
ingredients: {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Kikkoman Stir-Fry Sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'dry sherry'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'cornstarch'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'ground pork'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped onion'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'coarsely chopped cilantro leaves'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'Oriental sesame oil'}, {'quantity': None, 'unit': None, 'name': 'i'}
steps: Combine stir-fry sauce, sherry, and cornstarch; set aside.. Stir-fry pork, onion, and garlic together in hot wok or large skillet over high heat until pork is no longer pink; drain excess fat. Add stir-fry sauce mixture; cook, stirring, until pork is evenly coated with sauce. Remove from heat; stir in cilantro and sesame oil. To serve, place desired amount of meat mixture in lettuce leaf and wrap to enclose.

name: Easy Chicken Lettuce Wraps
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'deli-roasted chicken, meat removed and shredded'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shredded carrots'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped water chestnuts'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'Asian-style salad dressing'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'plain Greek yogurt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pinch', 'name': 'red pepper flakes, or to taste (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'head', 'name': 'Boston lettuce leaves'}
steps: Mix chicken, carrots, and water chestnuts together in a large bowl.. Stir salad dressing and yogurt together in a separate bowl until smooth; pour over the chicken mixture and toss to coat.. Spoon chicken mixture into lettuce leaves. Season with red pepper flakes.

name: One-Bite Thai "Flavor Bomb" Salad Wraps (Miang Kham)
ingredients: {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'unsweetened shredded dried coconut'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'finely chopped roasted peanuts'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'minced shallot'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'finely minced fresh ginger'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'small', 'name': 'lime, zested and juiced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'packed dark brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'fish sauce'}, {'quantity': '⅔', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'cubed cooked chicken'}, {'quantity': '32', 'unit': 'leaves', 'name': 'fresh spinach'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'toasted unsweetened coconut flakes'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'roasted peanuts'}, {'quantity': '32', 'unit': 'leaves', 'name': 'Thai basil'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'lime, quartered'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'finely chopped Thai chile peppers'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'diced shallot'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'diced fresh ginger'}

name: Asian-Inspired Chicken Lettuce Wraps
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'bunch', 'name': 'green onions, sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) can', 'name': 'water chestnuts, drained and diced'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'hoisin sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'light soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'Sriracha'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'rice vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'minced fresh ginger'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'red pepper flakes'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'diced yellow onion'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'ground chicken'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'sesame oil'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'leaves', 'name': 'Bibb lettuce, or more as needed'}
steps: Set 2 to 3 tablespoons green onions aside for garnish. Combine remaining green onions, water chestnuts, hoisin sauce, soy sauce, Sriracha, rice vinegar, ginger, and red pepper flakes in a bowl.. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Add onion and cook until softened, about 5 minutes. Add ground chicken, garlic, and sesame oil. Cook and stir until chicken is crumbly and no longer pink, 5 to 10 minutes.. Add hoisin mixture to the skillet and cook until heated through, about 5 minutes. Season with salt and pepper.. Fill lettuce leaves with chicken mixture and top with reserved green onions.

name: Ground Turkey Lettuce Wraps
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'yellow onion, diced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'ground turkey'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'rice vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'sesame oil'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'red pepper flakes'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground ginger'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'head', 'name': 'lettuce, separated into leaves'}
steps: Heat olive oil in a pan over medium-high heat. Add onion and soy sauce; cook until tender, about 5 minutes. Stir in garlic; cook until fragrant, about 1 minute. Add turkey and cook, breaking into smaller pieces, until no longer pink, about 5 minutes.. Make the sauce by whisking soy sauce, rice vinegar, brown sugar, sesame oil, red pepper flakes, and ginger together in a small bowl. Pour over turkey mixture and simmer until slightly reduced, 2 to 3 minutes.

name: Spicy Ground Beef Cabbage Wraps with Peanut Sauce
ingredients: {'quantity': '6', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'creamy peanut butter'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'low-sodium soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'sambal oelek (chile paste), or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'rice vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'grated ginger root'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, grated'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'red pepper flakes'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water, or more as needed'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'lean ground beef'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green onions, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large clove', 'name': 'garlic, finely minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'rice vinegar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'sambal oelek, or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cardamom'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'finely minced ginger root'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'ground cinnamon'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt and freshly ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'leaves', 'name': 'Napa cabbage'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': '', 'name': 'fresh lime wedges (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped peanuts'}
steps: Whisk peanut butter, soy sauce, sambal oelek, rice vinegar, ginger, garlic, and red pepper flakes for sauce together in a small bowl. Whisk in small amount of water slowly until well combined and you reach your desired consistency. Set aside.. Heat a medium skillet over medium heat. Brown the ground beef, green onions, and garlic for about 5 minutes. Stir in rice vinegar, sambal oelek, cardamom, ginger, cinnamon, salt, and pepper. Reduce heat and simmer for 2 to 3 minutes.. Divide the ground beef mixture evenly among the 12 cabbage leaves. Top each with a dollop of the peanut sauce, a squeeze of a lime wedge, and sprinkle with peanuts. Fold up the sides of the leaves and serve.

name: Chicken, Avocado, and Bacon Lettuce Wrap
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'bacon'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shredded rotisserie chicken'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'coarse salt and ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'avocado'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'tomato, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'lettuce leaves, or as needed'}
steps: Place bacon in a large skillet and cook over medium-high heat, turning occasionally, until evenly browned, about 10 minutes. Drain bacon slices on paper towels, reserving grease in skillet.. Add chicken to skillet and stir to coat with bacon drippings. Season with salt and pepper.. Mash avocado in a bowl and season with lemon juice, garlic, salt, and pepper. Add tomato and onion to taste.. Divide cooked bacon, chicken, and avocado spread between lettuce leaves and wrap up.

name: Millie Bobby Brown Eats This Snack Every Day on Set — So We Tried it Too
Vegan Lettuce Wraps
ingredients: {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetarian hoisin sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'water, or more to taste'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'sambal oelek (chile paste), or more to taste (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'vegetarian oyster sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'sambal oelek (chile paste) (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'mushroom seasoning'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'sesame oil'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'slices', 'name': 'ginger'}, {'quantity': '5', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'fried tofu, diced'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'jicama, peeled and diced'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': '', 'name': 'fresh shiitake mushrooms, diced'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'salt'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'ground black pepper to taste'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'red bell pepper, diced'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'butterhead lettuce leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'toasted sesame seeds, or to taste'}
steps: Mix hoisin sauce, 1 teaspoon water, and 1/2 teaspoon sambal oelek together to make dipping sauce.. Mix oyster sauce, 1 tablespoon water, 1/2 teaspoon sambal oelek, mushroom seasoning, sesame oil, sugar, and 1/4 teaspoon salt together in a bowl to make seasoning sauce.. Heat oil in a large skillet over medium heat. Cook and stir ginger until fragrant, about 30 seconds. Add tofu, jicama, shiitake mushrooms, 1/4 teaspoon salt, and pepper; cook and stir until mushrooms are golden brown, about 5 minutes. Add red bell pepper and seasoning sauce; cook and stir until heated through, about 1 minute. Remove from heat.. Place 1 to 2 tablespoons of tofu mixture in the center of each lettuce leaf. Sprinkle sesame seeds on top. Add 1 teaspoon dipping sauce; roll up lettuce to enclose tofu mixture. Repeat with remaining tofu mixture and lettuce leaves. Serve remaining dipping sauce alongside.

name: Turkey Lettuce Wraps with Shiitake Mushrooms
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'mai fun (angel hair) rice noodles'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': '', 'name': 'shiitake mushrooms, sliced'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(16 ounce) package', 'name': 'ground turkey'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green onions, chopped'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped water chestnuts'}, {'quantity': '4', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'finely minced fresh ginger root'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'minced garlic'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'rice vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'sesame oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'finely grated orange zest'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'leaves', 'name': 'green leaf lettuce'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'bean sprouts'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'carrot, grated'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'salted peanuts'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped fresh cilantro'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sweet chili sauce'}
steps: Bring 2 cups of water to a boil in a small saucepan. Turn off heat; stir in rice noodles. Cover, and allow noodles to soak until soft, 5 to 7 minutes. Rinse with cold water. Drain well.. Heat 1 teaspoon of the oil in a large skillet over medium-high heat. Cook the mushrooms in the hot oil until they are browned and softened, about 2 minutes. Remove the mushrooms from the pan. Reserve.. Heat the remaining 2 teaspoons of oil in the pan. Cook and stir the turkey in the oil until it is no longer pink, 5 to 7 minutes. Stir in the green onions, water chestnuts, ginger, and garlic; continue to cook for 1 minute. Mix in the reserved mushrooms, soy sauce, and brown sugar. Simmer briefly to combine the flavors. Take the pan off the heat; stir in the rice vinegar, sesame oil, and orange zest.. To assemble lettuce wraps, place a bit of turkey filling on each lettuce leaf. Top each with cooked noodles, and a sprinkle of bean sprouts, carrots, peanuts, and cilantro. Serve with sweet chili sauce for dipping.

name: Easy and Simple Vegetarian Lettuce Wraps
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'splash', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'rice'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped onion'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'clove', 'name': 'garlic, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'vegetable broth'}, {'quantity': '1 ½', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'head', 'name': 'romaine lettuce leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'dash', 'name': 'soy sauce, or to taste (Optional)'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'splash', 'name': 'lime juice, or to taste (Optional)'}
steps: Heat oil in a large saucepan over medium heat. Cook and stir rice in hot oil until golden brown, 3 to 5 minutes; add onions and garlic and cook until the onion is softened, 5 to 7 minutes more.. Pour vegetable broth and water into the saucepan; bring to a boil, reduce heat to low, place a cover on the saucepan, and cook rice at a simmer until tender and the liquid is absorbed, 10 to 15 minutes. Fluff rice and cook 1 to 2 minutes more.. Scoop rice mixture into lettuce leaves. Season with soy sauce or lime juice, as desired.

name: Shrimp Lettuce Wraps
ingredients: {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'butter'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'red bell pepper, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'large shrimp, peeled and deveined'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'Greek seasoning'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sliced cherry tomatoes, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': '', 'name': 'cucumber, halved and sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(4 ounce) can', 'name': 'sliced black olives'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'head', 'name': 'romaine lettuce, separated into individual leaves'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'feta cheese, crumbled'}
steps: Melt butter in a large nonstick skillet over medium-high heat. Add bell pepper; cook for 2 minutes. Add shrimp and garlic and sprinkle with Greek seasoning. Cook until shrimp are bright pink on the outside and the meat is opaque, 3 to 4 minutes. Remove from the heat and stir in cherry tomatoes, cucumber, and olives.. Serve shrimp mixture in romaine leaves and sprinkle with feta cheese.

name: Curried Chicken Lettuce Wraps
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'olive oil, or to taste'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'cubed cooked chicken'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'lime juice'}, {'quantity': '', 'unit': '', 'name': 'salt to taste'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'green apple, diced'}, {'quantity': '⅔', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'dried cranberries'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'toasted slivered almonds'}, {'quantity': '2 ½', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'thinly sliced green onions'}, {'quantity': '⅔', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'mayonnaise'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'curry powder'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'leaves', 'name': 'lettuce, or more to taste'}
steps: Heat oil in a skillet over medium heat. Add chicken, lime juice, and salt; cook and stir until chicken is no longer pink, 7 to 10 minutes. Remove from the heat.. Add apple, cranberries, almonds, and green onions to the chicken.. Mix mayonnaise and curry powder together in a large bowl. Add to chicken mixture and stir to coat. Transfer to the refrigerator until flavors have blended together, at least 1 hour, or overnight for more flavor.. Spoon chilled chicken salad into individual lettuce leaves. Wrap and eat with your fingers.

name: Asian Roll Lettuce Wrap
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'ground turkey'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'light soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'minced garlic'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'minced fresh ginger root'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'brown rice'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '16', 'unit': '', 'name': 'large lettuce leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'shredded carrots'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'green onions, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sliced red bell pepper'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'sliced radishes'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'light soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'fresh lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'minced garlic'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'minced fresh ginger root'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'sugar'}
steps: In a medium bowl, mix together ground turkey, 1 tablespoon soy sauce, 1 teaspoon minced garlic and 2 teaspoons ginger. Form into 16 meatballs and roll into ovals. Cover and refrigerate.. In a medium saucepan over medium heat, combine rice with 2 cups water. Bring to a boil, reduce heat and simmer for 20 minutes, or until rice is tender.. Preheat the grill or broiler. Arrange rice, lettuce leaves, carrots, scallions, radishes and red peppers onto a serving platter or place each into a small bowl. In a medium bowl, mix together 1/3 cup soy sauce, 1/3 cup water, lemon juice, 2 teaspoons garlic, 1 tablespoon ginger, and sugar. Divide into 4 small dipping bowls.. Thread two meatballs onto each 10 inch skewer. Grill or broil for 10 to 12 minutes, turning occasionally to brown all sides. If broiling, line the broiler pan with aluminum foil and drain fat after 6 minutes.. To eat, place a leaf of lettuce onto the palm of your hand, spoon on a little rice, then a meat roll, and a few of the vegetables. Roll up and dip in dipping sauce or spoon sauce over.

name: Vegan Lettuce Wraps with Tofu
ingredients: {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'hoisin sauce'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'minced fresh ginger root'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'rice vinegar'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'Sriracha sauce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'sesame oil'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'cloves', 'name': 'garlic, minced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(12 ounce) package', 'name': 'extra-firm tofu'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'grapeseed oil'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'medium', 'name': 'onion, chopped'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': '', 'name': 'baby bella mushrooms, chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '(8 ounce) can', 'name': 'water chestnuts, rinsed and chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'medium head', 'name': 'bibb or Boston lettuce, separated into leaves'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'Onions, spring or scallions (includes tops and bulb), raw'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'shredded carrots, or to taste'}
steps: Combine hoisin sauce, soy sauce, ginger, rice vinegar, Sriracha sauce, sesame oil, and garlic in a bowl; mix to combine and set aside.. Place tofu onto a plate and place another plate on top. Set a 3- to 5-pound weight on top. Press tofu for 20 to 30 minutes; drain and discard the accumulated liquid.. Heat oil in a skillet or wok over medium-high heat. Crumble tofu into the skillet and cook for 5 minutes. Add onion and cook and stir for 3 minutes. Stir in mushrooms and water chestnuts and cook for 2 to 3 minutes.. Stir in hoisin mixture and mix well. Cook enough for the liquid to reduce some.. Serve with lettuce and garnish with green onions and carrots.

name: Minced Pork and Watermelon Lettuce Wraps
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'vegetable oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'minced garlic'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'minced fresh ginger root'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'onion, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'lean ground pork'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'carrot, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'stalks', 'name': 'celery, finely chopped'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'chopped green onion'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'hoisin sauce'}, {'quantity': '¾', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'pine nuts'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': 'diced (1/2-inch) watermelon'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': '', 'name': 'iceberg lettuce leaves'}
steps: Heat the vegetable oil in a heavy, non-stick skillet over high heat. Cook and stir the garlic, ginger, and onion in the hot oil until fragrant, about 1 minute; add the ground pork to the mixture and cook until completely browned, 7 to 10 minutes. Drain any excess liquid from the skillet.. Reduce the heat to medium. Add the carrot and celery to the pork mixture; cook and stir until the carrot and celery begin to soften, 2 to 3 minutes. Stir the soy sauce and green onions into the mixture; remove the skillet from the heat and add the hoisin sauce and pine nuts. Stir the mixture until evenly mixed. Fold the watermelon into the mixture.. Spoon the pork mixture into the middle of the lettuce leaves; wrap the lettuce around the filling to serve.

name: Thai Lettuce Cups with Red Curry Potatoes
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'olive oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'Thai red curry paste'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'red potatoes, quartered lengthwise, cut crosswise into 1/2-inch pieces'}, {'quantity': '⅓', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'fresh lime juice'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'golden brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'Asian fish sauce (nam pla)'}, {'quantity': '6', 'unit': '', 'name': 'butter lettuce leaves'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'carrot, peeled and grated'}, {'quantity': '12', 'unit': 'sprigs', 'name': 'fresh cilantro'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green onions, thinly sliced'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'fresh mint leaves'}
steps: Preheat oven to 450 degrees F. Stir oil and curry paste to blend in large bowl. Add potatoes and toss to coat. Spread potatoes out on heavy large rimmed baking sheet. Roast potatoes until golden and tender, about 15 minutes.. Meanwhile: Stir lime juice, sugar and fish sauce to blend in small bowl for sauce.. Arrange lettuce leaves on platter. Top with carrots, cilantro, green onions and mint, dividing evenly. Spoon potatoes into cups. Serve, passing sauce separately.

name: CAMPBELL'S® Thai Tacos
ingredients: {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'lean ground pork'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'minced ginger'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'cups', 'name': "CAMPBELL'S® 30% Less Sodium Ready To Use Thai Chicken Broth"}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': '', 'name': 'green onions, sliced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'large', 'name': 'carrot, diced'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': '', 'name': 'red bell pepper, diced'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'hoisin sauce'}, {'quantity': '16', 'unit': 'leaves', 'name': 'Boston lettuce'}
steps: In large non-stick skillet, cook pork with ginger until pork is no longer pink, 5 to 7 minutes. Pour in broth and cook until reduced by about half, about 10 minutes.. Stir in green onions, carrot, red pepper, and hoisin and cook just until vegetables are tender-crisp, about 5 minutes more.. Serve pork mixture in lettuce leaves.

name: Amy's Lettuce Wraps
ingredients: {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'water'}, {'quantity': '¼', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'white sugar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'rice vinegar'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'ketchup'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'lemon juice'}, {'quantity': '⅛', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'sesame oil'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'tablespoon', 'name': 'dry mustard'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'teaspoons', 'name': 'water, divided'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'soy sauce'}, {'quantity': '2', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'brown sugar'}, {'quantity': '½', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'rice vinegar'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'peanut oil, divided'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'pound', 'name': 'ground pork'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'cup', 'name': 'minced water chestnuts'}, {'quantity': '8', 'unit': 'ounces', 'name': 'chopped fresh mushrooms'}, {'quantity': '3', 'unit': 'tablespoons', 'name': 'chopped green onion'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'minced garlic'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'head', 'name': 'iceberg lettuce'}, {'quantity': '1', 'unit': 'teaspoon', 'name': 'red chile paste, or more to taste'}
steps: Combine 1/2 cup water and white sugar together in a small microwave-safe bowl. Warm in the microwave to dissolve sugar, about 30 seconds. Add 2 tablespoons soy sauce, 2 tablespoons rice vinegar, ketchup, lemon juice, and sesame oil; mix until dipping sauce is well-blended. Cover with plastic wrap and chill, about 30 minutes.. Combine dry mustard with a few drops of water. Mix in remaining water until mixture is the consistency of hot mustard.. Whisk 2 tablespoons soy sauce, brown sugar, and ½ teaspoon rice vinegar in a small bowl to make stir-fry sauce.. Heat 2 tablespoons peanut oil in a wok or large skillet over high heat. Add pork; cook and stir until browned, about 5 minutes. Add remaining 1 tablespoon oil, water chestnuts, mushrooms, green onions, and garlic; saute until flavors combine, about 2 minutes. Pour in stir-fry sauce; stir to coat pork mixture evenly, 3 to 4 minutes.. Cut out lettuce stem and wash thoroughly. Discard outer leaf. Carefully peel off whole leaves and slice in half lengthwise. Arrange on a plate lined with paper towels.. Scoop dipping sauce into small bowls or ramekins. Mix in hot mustard and red chile paste to desired level of spiciness. Spoon pork filling into lettuce halves and roll up; top or dip wraps with dipping sauce.
